comment.realname: lifeasdaddy ...a guy, his wife, and their son...
comment.author: 13267298@N00
comment._content: M. R. Cobb played for the Livingston Field Club cricket team in 1902 according to this article: query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9B05E7DC113DEE32A... I daresay it is the same chap. The Australian Cricket Team travelled to England in 1912 to play a triangular series against England and South Africa. Perhaps the Aussie team stopped off in New York for an exhibition match against Captain Cobb's team.
